alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin. In western Maine, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waterville, Oakland, Jay, Belgrade, Livermore Falls, Chesterville, Fayette, Mount Vernon, Rome and Vienna.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
